hints.label: def-d-coupled-state
hints.title: Coupled Swarm State
hints.content:
737: :label: def-d-coupled-state
738: 
739: A **coupled swarm state** consists of two independent swarms evolving under the same transition kernel:
740: 
741: $$
742: (S_1, S_2) \in (\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \times \{0,1\})^{2N}
743: $$
hints.raw_directive:
734: To prove geometric ergodicity, we must show that **two independent copies** of the swarm converge to each other. This requires a Lyapunov function on the **coupled state space**.
735: 
736: :::{prf:definition} Coupled Swarm State
737: :label: def-d-coupled-state
738: 
739: A **coupled swarm state** consists of two independent swarms evolving under the same transition kernel:
740: 
741: $$
742: (S_1, S_2) \in (\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \times \{0,1\})^{2N}
743: $$
744:

hints.label: def-d-coupled-lyapunov
hints.title: Coupled Lyapunov Function (from `../1_euclidean_gas/03_cloning.md` and `../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md`)
hints.content:
749: :label: def-d-coupled-lyapunov
750: 
751: The **total Lyapunov function** is:
752: 
753: $$
754: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = c_V V_{\text{inter}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B V_{\text{boundary}}(S_1, S_2)
755: $$
756: 
757: where $c_V, c_B > 0$ are **coupling constants** to be chosen.
758: 
759: **Inter-Swarm Component:**
760: 
761: $$
762: V_{\text{inter}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + V_{\text{Var},v}(S_1, S_2)
763: $$
764: 
765: where:
766: 
767: **1. Wasserstein-2 Distance** (with hypocoercive cost):
768: 
769: $$
770: V_W(S_1, S_2) = W_h^2(\mu_1, \mu_2)
771: $$
772: 
773: where $\mu_k$ is the empirical measure of alive walkers in swarm $k$, and $W_h$ is the Wasserstein-2 distance with respect to the **hypocoercive norm** (defined in Section 3.2):
774: 
775: $$
776: \|((\Delta x, \Delta v))\|_h^2 = \|\Delta x\|^2 + \lambda_v \|\Delta v\|^2 + b \langle \Delta x, \Delta v \rangle
777: $$
778: 
779: **2. Position Variance Sum:**
780: 
781: $$
782: V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) = V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1) + V_{\text{Var},x}(S_2)
783: $$
784: 
785: where $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_k) = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i: s_{k,i}=1} \|x_{k,i} - \bar{x}_k\|^2$.
786: 
787: :::{admonition} Normalization by $N$ (not $N_{\text{alive}}$)
788: :class: note

hints.label: thm-main-convergence
hints.title: Geometric Ergodicity of the Geometric Gas
hints.content:
828: :label: thm-main-convergence
829: 
830: Consider the Geometric Gas with:
831: 1. Adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$ satisfying uniform ellipticity (Theorem [](#thm-uniform-ellipticity))
832: 2. Confining potential $U(x)$ satisfying coercivity (Axiom 1.3.1 from `../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md`)
833: 3. Regularization $\epsilon_\Sigma > 0$ large enough that $c_{\min} \ge c_{\min}^*$ for some threshold $c_{\min}^*$
834: 
835: Then there exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ and **N-uniform** constants $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$, $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$ such that:
836: 
837: **1. Foster-Lyapunov Condition:**
838: 
839: $$
840: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(S_1', S_2') \mid S_1, S_2] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{total}}
841: $$
842: 
843: for all coupled states $(S_1, S_2)$ with $N_{\text{alive},k}(S_k) \ge 1$.
844: 
845: **2. Geometric Ergodicity:**
846: 
847: There exists a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ such that:
848: 
849: $$
850: \left\| \mathcal{L}(S_t \mid S_0) - \pi_{\text{QSD}} \right\|_{\text{TV}} \le C_\pi (1 + V_{\text{total}}(S_0, S_0)) \rho^t
851: $$
852: 
853: where $\rho = 1 - \kappa_{\text{total}} < 1$ and $C_\pi < \infty$ are **independent of $N$**.
854: 
855: **3. Explicit Rate:**
856: 
857: $$
858: \kappa_{\text{total}} = O\left(\min\left\{\gamma \tau, \, \kappa_x^{\text{clone}}, \, c_{\min}\right\}\right)
859: $$
860: 
861: where:
862: - $\gamma \tau$ is the kinetic contraction rate (friction × timestep)
hints.raw_directive:
825: ### 4.2. Main Convergence Theorem
826: 
827: :::{prf:theorem} Geometric Ergodicity of the Geometric Gas
828: :label: thm-main-convergence
829: 
830: Consider the Geometric Gas with:
831: 1. Adaptive diffusion $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$ satisfying uniform ellipticity (Theorem [](#thm-uniform-ellipticity))
832: 2. Confining potential $U(x)$ satisfying coercivity (Axiom 1.3.1 from `../1_euclidean_gas/06_convergence.md`)
833: 3. Regularization $\epsilon_\Sigma > 0$ large enough that $c_{\min} \ge c_{\min}^*$ for some threshold $c_{\min}^*$
834: 
835: Then there exist coupling constants $c_V, c_B > 0$ and **N-uniform** constants $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$, $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$ such that:
836: 
837: **1. Foster-Lyapunov Condition:**
838: 
839: $$
840: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(S_1', S_2') \mid S_1, S_2] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) + C_{\text{total}}
841: $$
842: 
843: for all coupled states $(S_1, S_2)$ with $N_{\text{alive},k}(S_k) \ge 1$.
844: 
845: **2. Geometric Ergodicity:**
846: 
847: There exists a unique quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ such that:
848: 
849: $$
850: \left\| \mathcal{L}(S_t \mid S_0) - \pi_{\text{QSD}} \right\|_{\text{TV}} \le C_\pi (1 + V_{\text{total}}(S_0, S_0)) \rho^t
851: $$
852: 
853: where $\rho = 1 - \kappa_{\text{total}} < 1$ and $C_\pi < \infty$ are **independent of $N$**.
854: 
855: **3. Explicit Rate:**
856: 
857: $$
858: \kappa_{\text{total}} = O\left(\min\left\{\gamma \tau, \, \kappa_x^{\text{clone}}, \, c_{\min}\right\}\right)
859: $$
860: 
861: where:
862: - $\gamma \tau$ is the kinetic contraction rate (friction × timestep)
863: - $\kappa_x^{\text{clone}}$ is the cloning position variance contraction rate (from `../1_euclidean_gas/03_cloning.md`)
